Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Why is the minimum trading amount so high in this testphase

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: trying to sell 25 KMD for btc but minimum trade is 0,0777. Bit lame that i need to put so "much" on to the app to test it

Author: cipi#4502
Content: BTC txfee is 1$, so trading lesser then 100$ of BTC makes no sense

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: So if i trade kmd for dex i can do lower trades?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, min. trade is 0.0077 and it applies to all coins

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Oh wait, kmd uses btc hashing power

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: i understand, so its a bit of a bottleneck for smaller trades

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: That has nothing to do with it.

Author: cipi#4502
Content: yes, for coins with high txfees, like BTC... and sometimes ERC20

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: So basically the DEX is not useful for transferring small amounts of money/value? Edit: wrong example. With mass adoption, most ppl will be transferring smaller amounts i imagine. Not everyone is a whale moving 2BTC around all the time.

Author: Acura#2748
Content: It's not a bug - minimal swap amount is 0.00777 determined by protocol and the same for all coins. I'm agree that it's quite high amount in USD equialent. But from another side it's better to trade huge amounts of BTC because of tx fees.

Author: cipi#4502
Content: use something else other the bTC or ERC20, eg BCH or LTC or KMD and you can transfer low amounts of money

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: Ah oke, ill give it a try

Author: Jimm B.#9993
Content: have swapped kmd for doge and doge for kmd.  was surprised by the 10 doge transaction fees.  are they really that high?

Author: Jimm B.#9993
Content: in $ it is not much but when you get used to the 0.0001 of KMD + Ecosystem, it seems pretty high.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
<https://multidoge.org/help/v0.1/help_whatIsTheTransactionFee.html>
> 1 doge per 1 kb of txn size

Author: Jimm B.#9993
Content: so there is no way to get rid of the dust left over?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
no way through atomicDEX directly
one solution is to import the private key into a doge wallet with balance and let the dust be used there in a future transaction

any way doge dust should be of very low value
other than cluttering the ui, there is no harm I think

Author: Jimm B.#9993
Content: You're right, it has almost no value.  I just do not like dustüòè .  first I thought of a donate button in the app ... but if you can not send the dust ...
